marketNews.title: Israel Attacks Iran, Oil & Gold Prices Surge
marketNews.content: Prime Minister of Israel, Benjamin Netanyahu, announced that the Israeli military launched an attack on Iran, targeting nuclear facilities, military sites, and ballistic missiles. The operation was carried out as a step to prevent Iran from further developing nuclear weapons. The attack killed the highest commander of Iran's Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps, Hossein Salami, as well as the chief of staff and senior nuclear scientists. Iran's Supreme Leader, Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, said Iran will retaliate. Meanwhile, US Secretary of State Marco Rubio claimed that the US was not involved, although the US had known the attack would happen. Iran is the third largest producer in OPEC+ with production about 3.3 million barrels per day, about 3% of global production, and sells almost all to China. According to New York Times, China has large strategic oil reserves from over a decade of purchases, which can help China survive several weeks of global oil supply disruption. Bloomberg reported that the escalation also raises concerns about Iran potentially blockading the Strait of Hormuz, which carries about 26% of total global oil trade. The strait is also important for LNG, with more than one fifth of global LNG supply passing through. Following the Israeli attack, Brent crude futures for August 2025 rose up to +13.17% to $78.5 per barrel on Friday (13/6), before easing to +8.29% later that day. On the same day, spot gold rose up to +1.88% before easing to +1.15% at $3,442 per troy ounce. Stock markets reacted negatively on Friday (13/6), with Nikkei (-0.92%), Hang Seng (-0.59%), and Indonesia's IHSG (-0.53%) closing weaker, while S&P 500 Futures fell -0.94%. Key Takeaway: Following the commodity price rise, shares of oil and gold producers strengthened on Friday (13/6), such as $MEDC (+9.38%), $ENRG (+7.03%), $RATU (+7.39%), $ANTM (+4.10%), $PSAB (+7.00%), and $ARCI (+23.21%). However, the commodity price increase may be accompanied by higher volatility, so the conflict development should be closely monitored by investors.

marketNews.title: Other Hot Things You Need to Know
marketNews.content:
1. Bank Indonesia estimates retail sales in May 2025 will grow +2.6% YoY, although still contracting -0.6% MoM. In April 2025, retail sales recorded a contraction of -0.3% YoY and -5.1% MoM (vs March 2025: +5.5% YoY, +13.6% MoM), better than BI's forecast of -2.2% YoY and -6.9% MoM. The April decline was caused by normalization of demand after Ramadan and Eid al-Fitr.
2. President Prabowo Subianto openly invited foreign investors to co-finance an $80 billion seawall project to prevent flooding on the northern coast of Java. He said investors from China and Japan have been invited, without further details. The project is expected to last 20 years, with the seawall stretching about 700 km from Banten to East Java.
3. President Prabowo on Thursday (12/6) said he has no intention to reshuffle the cabinet soon because he is satisfied with his ministers. Earlier rumors of a reshuffle arose amid intensified meetings with PDI-P leader Megawati and public scrutiny of some ministers.
4. Indonesia and Singapore on Friday (13/6) signed a memorandum of understanding to develop low-carbon electricity trade and collaborate on a carbon capture and storage project. The MoU will set policies, regulatory frameworks, and business arrangements to allow Indonesian electricity to be supplied to Singapore. They will also consider a legally binding agreement for cross-border CCS, which would be the first in Asia. Both countries also signed an agreement to develop a sustainable industrial zone on several Indonesian islands near Singapore, including Batam, Bintan, and Karimun.
5. Minister of Religious Affairs Nasaruddin Umar said on Friday (13/6) that there is no official discussion from Saudi authorities regarding a possible 50% reduction of the Hajj quota in 2026. Earlier, the head of the Hajj Agency, Mochamad Irfan Yusuf, said on Tuesday (10/6) that Saudi authorities were considering cutting the 2026 Hajj quota by 50%.

tickerNews.title: MEDC Shares Rise After Commodity Price Surge
tickerNews.content: Shares of MEDC rose +9.38% on Friday (13/6) following the commodity price increase.

tickerNews.content: Shares of ENRG rose +7.03% on Friday (13/6) following the commodity price increase.

tickerNews.title: SMRA Reports Marketing Sales of 1.8 Trillion Rupiah
tickerNews.content: Summarecon Agung reported marketing sales of 1.8 trillion rupiah for the first five months of 2025, up 20% YoY, representing 36% of the 2025 target of 5 trillion rupiah.

tickerNews.title: PTBA Plans 7.2 Trillion Rupiah Capex for 2025
tickerNews.content: Bukit Asam announced it will allocate a capex of 7.2 trillion rupiah for 2025, up from 2.3 trillion rupiah realized in 2024, driven by logistics projects including railway line upgrades. The company also maintains a coal production target of 50 million metric tons for 2025.

tickerNews.title: BSSR Explores New Coal Mine and Adjusts Capex
tickerNews.content: Baramulti Suksessarana announced it is exploring a new coal mine as part of inorganic growth, with 25% of new PKP2B land (about 4,000 ha) opened. Capex for 2025 is set at 25 million USD, down from 81 million USD in 2024, with a production target of 18.5 million tons for 2025.

tickerNews.title: PBSA Approves 2024 Dividend
tickerNews.content: Paramita Bangun Sarana shareholders approved a dividend for fiscal year 2024 of approximately 165 billion rupiah, or 55 rupiah per share, representing a 77% dividend payout ratio and an implied dividend yield of 12.4% as of Friday (13/6).

tickerNews.title: TINS Announces 2024 Dividend
tickerNews.content: Timah shareholders approved a dividend for fiscal year 2024 of approximately 475 billion rupiah, or about 63.7 rupiah per share, representing a 40% dividend payout ratio and an implied dividend yield of about 5.5% as of Friday (13/6).

tickerNews.title: SCCO Declares 2024 Dividend
tickerNews.content: Supreme Cable Manufacturing & Commerce announced a dividend for fiscal year 2024 of approximately 82 billion rupiah, or 100 rupiah per share, representing a 28% dividend payout ratio and an implied dividend yield of 4.5% as of Friday (13/6).

tickerNews.title: KINO Announces 2024 Dividend
tickerNews.content: Kino Indonesia announced a dividend for fiscal year 2024 of approximately 44 billion rupiah, or 32 rupiah per share, representing about a 51% dividend payout ratio and an implied dividend yield of 2.8% as of Friday (13/6).

tickerNews.title: UCID Announces 2024 Dividend
tickerNews.content: Uni-Charm Indonesia shareholders approved a dividend for fiscal year 2024 of approximately 70 billion rupiah, or about 16.9 rupiah per share, representing a 20% dividend payout ratio and an implied dividend yield of 3.1% as of Friday (13/6).

tickerNews.title: SOLA Secures Contract with Pertamina Hulu Rokan
tickerNews.content: Xolare RCR Energy announced that its subsidiary, PT Modifikasi Bitumen Sumatera, has secured a contract worth approximately 41 billion rupiah from PT Pertamina Hulu Rokan for the supply of 3,800 metric tons of CMS-2 type asphalt emulsion.
